original_title: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
overview: Two thousand years ago, in the Roman province of Judea, Jesus was crucified by imperial troops.  Thousands before him had suffered the same fate.  But unlike his predecessors on the cross, Jesus did not disappear from history.  Instead, his memory was kept alive by a small band of Jews - men and women who held fast to their conviction that Jesus was the Messiah.
tagline: Early Christianity faced powerful obstacles, but this new faith would not die.
title: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
